name: MessageType
documentation:
Enumerates the types of messages recognized and routed by the Fluxzero Runtime.

Each message type represents a semantic category of communication, such as commands, events, queries, or errors. These types inform how messages are tracked, handled, and optionally responded to.

Each {@code MessageType} has two behavioral flags:

Usage Examples:

  • {@code COMMAND} – a state-changing request with an optional result (e.g., CreateUser)
  • {@code EVENT} – a broadcast message representing something that happened
  • {@code QUERY} – a read-only request expecting a result
  • {@code ERROR} – indicates failure of a prior message
  • {@code WEBREQUEST} / {@code WEBRESPONSE} – HTTP/WebSocket message flows via Fluxzero

fields.name: request
fields.documentation: Whether this message type expects a response.

fields.name: response
fields.documentation: Whether this message type represents a response to a request.

enumConstants.name: COMMAND
enumConstants.documentation:
A request to perform an action or change state. Usually processed by a command handler and optionally followed by
 a {@link #RESULT}.

enumConstants.name: CUSTOM
enumConstants.documentation: A message from a custom message topic.

enumConstants.name: DOCUMENT
enumConstants.documentation: A message containing an updated search document from a given collection.

enumConstants.name: ERROR
enumConstants.documentation: A handler failure in response to a request message or generic system failure.

enumConstants.name: EVENT
enumConstants.documentation: A record of something that occurred. Does not expect a response.

enumConstants.name: METRICS
enumConstants.documentation: Internal system event used for diagnostics and monitoring.

enumConstants.name: NOTIFICATION
enumConstants.documentation: Same as events, but used in a fan-out strategy when a consumer is interested in events across all segments.

enumConstants.name: QUERY
enumConstants.documentation: A request for data or read-only information. Typically returns a {@link #RESULT}.

enumConstants.name: RESULT
enumConstants.documentation: The result of handling a request (e.g. command, query).

enumConstants.name: SCHEDULE
enumConstants.documentation: A scheduled message to be delivered at a specific time.

enumConstants.name: WEBREQUEST
enumConstants.documentation: A tracked web request routed to a handler via HTTP or WebSocket. Expects a {@link #WEBRESPONSE}.

enumConstants.name: WEBRESPONSE
enumConstants.documentation: A response to a {@link #WEBREQUEST}, typically an HTTP or WebSocket reply.
